intro: Sisymbrium ventanense, commonly known as the Mexican babylon wheat, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Brassicaceae family, which includes mustard and cabbage plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, yellow flowers that bloom in late spring. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and often have a slightly hairy texture. Sisymbrium ventanense is typically found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and disturbed soils.
